history.content: For each of the 194s as they are developed, someone has to request that it be accepted as an upper division course counting for the 20 unit requirement. Many of the 194s have been accepted (see this list), but I think that this may be this first time that 194-196 is being offered and no one has yet had the Vice Chair review it. You can submit a request to the Vice Chair using this form. I believe that @15822 was written before the faculty started adding their 194s to the calendar; there have been a number of them added, as they often are in the last weeks of the semester; on the EE side, you'll likewise see 290s being offered late in the semester; both are the faculty's methods for offering classes on their most recent research and sometimes develop it into regular courses.

I remember someone telling me that CS 194 classes count towards the 20 units we have to take for the Upper Div CS requirement, but I can't find any concrete information about it and wanted to ask about the class specifically.

Additionally, per @15822, none of the 194 classes are being offered - but on the class catalog, there are professors listed, with a time and location, for CS 194-196's offering. 

https://classes.berkeley.edu/content/2022-spring-compsci-194-196-lec-196
history.subject: Does CS 194-196 count towards the Upper Division CS Requirement?
